                          GrammarException
Constructor: parses the grammar and obtains the corresponding regular expression

Parameters:
xmlContent - String with the xml grammar
Throws:
org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException - If the grammar format is not correct or it cannot be read
GrammarException - If the grammar format is not correct
Method Detail

getAttributes

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAttributes(org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParser parser)
Returns the attributes of the current tag (e.g. field name), or null if it has no attributes. The parser must be placed in the current tag before invoking this method Idea modified from: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4827168/how-to-parse-the-value-in-the-attribute-in-xml-parsing

parse

private void parse(java.lang.String xmlContent)
            throws org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException,
                   GrammarException
Parses the XML grammar contained in the xmlContent String to a list of phrases

Throws:
org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException - If the grammar format is not correct or it cannot be read
GrammarException - If the grammar format is not correct

computeRegularExpression

private java.lang.String computeRegularExpression()
                                           throws GrammarException
Transforms the list of phrases obtained from parsing a XML grammar into a regular expression

Returns:
a String containing the regular expression
Throws:
GrammarException

solveReferences

private java.lang.String solveReferences()
                                  throws GrammarException
It solves the references in a regular expression corresponding to a grammar

Returns:
Regular expression
Throws:
GrammarException - Parsing error

recalculateParenthesis

private void recalculateParenthesis(java.lang.String reference,
                                    int referencePosition)
Recalculates the positions of the groups in the regular expression when a rule reference is solved (see chapter 6)

obtainSemantics

public java.lang.String obtainSemantics(java.lang.String utterance)
                                 throws GrammarException
Checks whether the utterance is valid according to the handcrafted grammar. If it is valid, it returns its semantic interpretation, if not it returns null

Throws:
GrammarException - It the grammar was not initialized in advance

getMatchingSemanticTag

private java.lang.String getMatchingSemanticTag(int group,
                                                java.lang.String keyword)
Obtains the semantic tag for a recognized keyword in the phrase number group
